Name: Painted and Inscribed Sarcophagus of Sepi
Description: This is one of the most magnificent inscribed and painted sarcophagi from the Middle Kingdom. It is made for the General Sepi of the fifteenth nome of Upper Egypt. The exterior sides of the wooden sarcophagus are decorated with painted hieroglyphs depicting the names, titles, and offering formula. Two Udjat eyes are located at the top of the false door that is depicted on the side, to which the mask of the anthropoid coffin is turned.The interior decoration is entirely painted and contains a series of spells in cursive hieroglyphs taken from the Coffin Texts and from the Book of the Two Ways that contained a map of the underworld.
